title: War & Battles Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About War & Battles
description: Test your knowledge of the 18 biblical commandments related to war & battles. Covers 9 positive and 9 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which commandment in the War and Battles category requires offering peace terms to a city before attacking?
options: Offer peace terms to the inhabitants of a city while holding siege
Appoint a priest to speak with the soldiers during the war
questions.correctAnswer: Offer peace terms to the inhabitants of a city while holding siege
questions.explanation: Commandment #602 instructs to offer peace terms to a city when holding siege, as stated in Deuteronomy 20:10.

questions.question: What is forbidden concerning fruit trees during a siege according to the War and Battles commandments?
options: You must destroy all fruit trees
You must water the fruit trees
Do not destroy fruit trees even during the siege
questions.correctAnswer: Do not destroy fruit trees even during the siege
questions.explanation: Commandment #604 forbids destroying fruit trees during siege to prevent unnecessary destruction, from Deuteronomy 20:19.

questions.question: Which commandment is a positive mitzvah about remembering a historical enemy's attack on Israel?
options: Remember what Amalek did to the Israelites
Do not panic and retreat during battle
questions.correctAnswer: Remember what Amalek did to the Israelites
questions.explanation: Commandment #599 is positive and commands remembrance of Amalek’s attack, from Deuteronomy 25:17.

questions.question: Which of the following commandments is negative?
options: Prepare a shovel for each soldier to dig with
Do not let any of the seven Canaanite nations remain alive
Appoint a priest to speak with the soldiers during the war
Keep the laws of the captive woman
questions.correctAnswer: Do not let any of the seven Canaanite nations remain alive
questions.explanation: Commandment #597 is negative, forbidding leaving any of the seven Canaanite nations alive, from Deuteronomy 20:16.

questions.question: According to the commandments, what must a man who has taken a new wife be exempt from for one year?
questions.explanation: Commandment #608 states a man with a new wife is exempt from army duty for one year, from Deuteronomy 24:5.

questions.question: What is the scriptural basis for preparing latrines outside the camps during war?
questions.explanation: Commandments #605 and #606 instruct preparing latrines and shovels outside the camp, found in Deuteronomy 23:13-14.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids selling a captive woman into slavery after taking her?
options: Do not sell a captive woman into slavery
Keep the laws of the captive woman
Do not retain a captive woman for servitude
Offer peace terms to the inhabitants
questions.correctAnswer: Do not sell a captive woman into slavery
questions.explanation: Commandment #612 forbids selling a captive woman after taking her, from Deuteronomy 21:14.

questions.question: Which commandment is positive and involves appointing a spiritual leader to encourage soldiers before battle?
options: Appoint a priest to speak with the soldiers during the war
Offer peace terms to the inhabitants
questions.correctAnswer: Appoint a priest to speak with the soldiers during the war
questions.explanation: Commandment #607 requires a priest to speak to soldiers to encourage them before battle, from Deuteronomy 20:2.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids panicking and retreating during battle?
options: Do not panic and retreat during battle
Prepare a shovel for each soldier
questions.correctAnswer: Do not panic and retreat during battle
questions.explanation: Commandment #610 forbids panic and retreat, encouraging courage in battle, from Deuteronomy 20:3.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids preventing a third-generation Egyptian convert from marrying into the Covenant people?
options: Do not prevent a third-generation Egyptian convert from marrying
Do not let any Canaanite remain alive
questions.correctAnswer: Do not prevent a third-generation Egyptian convert from marrying
questions.explanation: Commandment #164 forbids barring a third-generation Egyptian convert from marriage, from Deuteronomy 23:7.

questions.question: Which commandment is positive and requires wiping out the descendants of Amalek?
options: Wipe out the descendants of Amalek
Offer peace terms to a city
questions.correctAnswer: Wipe out the descendants of Amalek
questions.explanation: Commandment #598 commands wiping out Amalek’s descendants as a positive mitzvah, from Deuteronomy 25:19.

questions.question: Which negative commandment forbids retaining a captive woman for servitude after relations?
options: Do not retain a captive woman for servitude after relations
Do not sell a captive woman into slavery
questions.correctAnswer: Do not retain a captive woman for servitude after relations
questions.explanation: Commandment #613 prohibits keeping a captive woman for servitude after relations, from Deuteronomy 21:14.

questions.question: Which commandment commands preparing a shovel for each soldier to dig with?
options: Prepare a shovel for each soldier to dig with
Offer peace terms to the city
questions.correctAnswer: Prepare a shovel for each soldier to dig with
questions.explanation: Commandment #606 commands providing a shovel to each soldier, from Deuteronomy 23:14.

questions.question: According to the commandments, which group is explicitly forbidden from being detested by the Israelites?
questions.explanation: Commandments #164 and #165 prohibit detesting Edomites and Egyptians, from Deuteronomy 23:7.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #609 forbids demanding communal or military involvement from a man during the first year of his marriage.
questions.explanation: Commandment #609 states that no military or communal duties should be demanded from a man during his first year of marriage, from Deuteronomy 24:5.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #597 allows some of the seven Canaanite nations to remain alive after conquest.
questions.explanation: Commandment #597 forbids leaving any of the seven Canaanite nations alive, from Deuteronomy 20:16.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #610 encourages soldiers to fear and panic during battle.
questions.explanation: Commandment #610 forbids fear and panic in battle, encouraging courage instead, from Deuteronomy 20:3.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #605 requires the camp to be kept holy by proper sanitation measures.
questions.explanation: Commandment #605 mandates preparing latrines to keep the camp holy, from Deuteronomy 23:13.
